October 7, 1990: Fiction
FOUR PAST MIDNIGHT, by Stephen King. (Viking, $22.95.) Four novellas about
horror and terror in the late-night hours.
MEMORIES OF MIDNIGHT, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $21.95.) The destiny of
an American woman is haunted by a vengeful Greek tycoon.
THE GENERAL IN HIS LABYRINTH, by Gabriel Garcia Marquez. (Knopf, $19.95.)
The last, sad retrospective days of the Latin American revolutionary Simon
Bolivar.
THE BURDEN OF PROOF, by Scott Turow. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $22.95.) An
attorney tries to unravel the mystery of his wife's death.
HOCUS POCUS, by Kurt Vonnegut. (Putnam, $21.95.) Life in the near future as
noted by a college professor and prison administrator in upstate New York.
SURRENDER THE PINK, by Carrie Fisher. (Simon & Schuster, $18.95.) The
romantic misadventures of a woman soap opera writer in Hollywood, New York
and the Hamptons.
SPY SINKER, By Len Deighton. (Bessie/HarperCollins, $21.95). The adventures
of a woman torn between love for her family and her duties as a spy for British
intelligence in East Germany.
THE WOMEN IN HIS LIFE, by Barbara Taylor Bradford. (Random House, $21.95.)
The rise of a tycoon and his relationships with five women.
LADY BOSS, by Jackie Collins. (Simon & Schuster, $21.95.) Lucky Santangelo
schemes and maneuvers to get control of a major movie studio.
MESSAGE FROM NAM, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $21.95.) A woman
journalist's coming of age in the 1960's and 70's.
OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO! by Dr. Seuss. (Random House, $12.95.) The
problems of finding your way through life; in verse and pictures.
THE STAND, by Stephen King. (Doubleday, $24.95.) Doomsday brings horrors to
America; the uncut version of a novel first published in 1978.
PRIME DIRECTIVE, by Judith and Garfield Reeves-Stevens. (Pocket, $18.95.)
The former crew members of ''Star Trek'' 's Enterprise on a mission to discover
why their careers were ruined.
SEPTEMBER, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (Dunne/St. Martin's, $22.95.) Guests from
many parts of the world at a get-together in a small Scottish town.
A BED BY THE WINDOW, By M. Scott Peck. (Bantam, $18.95.) A detective
October 7, 1990
Non-Fiction
BY WAY OF DECEPTION, by Victor Ostrovsky and Claire Hoy. (St. Martin's,
$22.95.) An account of the operations of Mossad, the Israeli spy service, by a
former agent.
MILLIE'S BOOK, as dictated to Barbara Bush. (Morrow, $17.95.) The memoirs of
the English springer spaniel who lives in the White House.
GET TO THE HEART, by Barbara Mandrell with George Vecsey. (Bantam,
$19.95.) The autobiography of the country-music singer.
DARKNESS VISIBLE, by William Styron. (Random House, $15.95.) The novelist's
memoir of a period of severe depression.
BOOTLEGGER'S BOY, by Barry Switzer with Bud Shrake. (Morrow, $19.95) The
autobiography of the former college football coach at the University of Oklahoma.
YOU JUST DON'T UNDERSTAND, by Deborah Tannen. (Morrow, $18.95.) The
different languages men and women speak.
NOW YOU KNOW, by Kitty Dukakis with Jane Scovell. (Simon & Schuster,
$19.95.) A self-portrait of the wife of the 1988 Presidential nominee.
EVERY SPY A PRINCE, by Dan Raviv and Yossi Melman. (Jaffe/Houghton Mifflin,
$24.95.) A history of the Israeli intelligence community.
DON'T SHOOT, IT'S ONLY ME, by Bob Hope with Melville Shavelson. (Putnam,
$19.95.) Reminiscences of a life in show business.
THE POLITICS OF RICH AND POOR, by Kevin Phillips. (Random House,
$19.95.) How the rich got richer during the 1980's.
TRUMP: Surviving at the Top, by Donald J. Trump with Charles Leerhsen.
(Random House, $21.95.) The entrepreneur reflects on his recent past.
DAVE BARRY TURNS 40, by Dave Barry. (Crown, $16.95.) Thoughts about the
crises of middle age.
FRIDAY NIGHT LIGHTS, by H. G. Bissinger. (Addison-Wesley, $19.95.) A high
school football season in Odessa, Tex.
BARBARIANS AT THE GATE, by Bryan Burrough and John Helyar. (Harper
Collins, $22.95.) The 1988 battle for control of RJR Nabisco.
MEN AT WORK, by George F. Will. (Macmillan, $19.95.) The craft of baseball.
CLOSER TO THE LIGHT, by Melvin Morse with Paul Perry. (Villard, $17.95.) A
doctor examines the experiences of young patients who almost died.
